1.comment: Don't you hate that one player that wants a theme that nobody else wants?
1.description: Somebody in the lobby requests a theme, and usually it's one that nobody else wants (i.e. cat theme).

2.comment: TIP: Players who cooperate with their team win more games.
2.description: A player (most likely a townie) calls the town stupid (probably because they're about to be lynched).

3.comment: TIP: Randomly lynching a player favors the evil roles.
3.description: Someone gets lynched with no evidence, despite having a claim.

4.comment: There's a reason new players stick to classic.
4.description: Someone, probably because they claimed being new, gets told by someone, probably a more veteran player, to go play classic.
4.display-text: Someone gets told to go back to classic

5.comment: Actually, I'm over here making a 30,000 iQ jest play, thanks.
5.description: Someone gets accused of throwing. For example, if they claim red vigilante as solo mafioso.

6.comment: Listen, I don't like framer either, but I still play it out.
6.description: 3 or more players disconnect (doesn't have to be all at once). Usually, this will happen on day 1 if it's a crap role, or on the stand if they rage quit.
6.display-text: 3 or more suicides in a single game

7.comment: Mafia was roleblocked or hit an immune.
7.description: A night passes and nobody dies. Usually there will be like 3 people roleblocked, 1 jailed, and 1 pirated; or mafia hit an immune.

8.comment: Stop ordering pizza as soon as you sit down to play Town of Salem.
8.description: One of the mafia members is AFK. Usually, when another mafia member gets lynched, they'll make sure town knows.

9.comment: Thanks for blowing my jest cover...jeez.
9.description: Somebody in the town get called an idiot by someone else. This will almost certainly happen if the jailor doesn't jail who town wants jailed.
9.display-text: Someone calls someone else an idiot

10.description: A confirmed executioner lives for a surprisingly long time. They probably pushed a townie in a 1 for 1, and town forgot about them; or evils have majority.
10.display-text: Confirmed exe lives for a long time

11.comment: Why? Doctor is such an easy role.
11.description: Somebody with a town role disconnects on day 1, and they're almost certainly something useful like spy, investigator, or jailor.

12.comment: Well, I guess that player is dead now.
12.description: The investigator finds someone that has the correct results to be mayor or jailor. A smart investigator would whisper the jailor and post fake results.

1.comment: TIP: Wills are a powerful tool, use them to your advantage.
1.description: A townie that dies either has a blank will, or they didn't update their will to say where they went. Inevitably, they visited the werewolf.

2.comment: Careful with that thing, you'll shoot your eye out...oh...nevermind.
2.description: A vigilante shoot a town member at night. You'll find out tomorrow why this is bad. This usually happens when vigilantes shoot without asking for role.

3.comment: Well, I guess they won't be making that mistake again this game.
3.description: The jailor executes a town member at night. Probably because the jailor didn't ask for a claim, or didn't like their claim.

4.comment: You know that's a reportable offense, right?
4.description: Someone throws the game. There are many ways this can happen: a town member could ignore town investigatives, an evil could give up their team while getting lynched, among others. A solo evil claiming doesn't count as a throw.

5.comment: Well, hotshot, now they know for sure there is an arsonist. Good job.
5.description: An arsonist ignites their doused targets on night 2. This is bad for the arsonist because it starts the arsonist hunt.

6.comment: Why? You know what has to happen now.
6.description: Vigilante openly claims in a coven leader game. This is a problem because the coven leader can use the vigilante against the town. Claiming TK doesn't count.
6.display-text: Vigilante claims in a coven leader game

7.comment: You had 1 job...just 1 job...and you failed.
7.description: A veteran dies on night 1, whether or not they baited.
7.display-text: Veteran doesn't alert night 1 and dies

8.comment: Seriously? You fell for that? lmao
8.description: A member of the mafia falls for a vet bait, and dies to the veteran. The one they usually fall for is "vet bait".

9.comment: I don't think that's what they meant by eye for an eye.
9.description: A mafia member dies to coven and a coven member dies to mafia in the same night.

10.description: The first thing someone says when they get voted up is "why me?".

11.comment: You did get the Werewolf lynched, but doesn't this count as a throw?
11.description: Someone evil reveals their role, just to get a target lynched. Like a blackmailer revealing because the werewolf is whispering the survivor or their guardian angel.
11.display-text: Evil reveals to get someone lynched

12.comment: You're still not a vigilante. Don't kid yourself.
12.description: Someone says they are a [insert color] vigilante, such as mafioso claiming red vigilante, serial killer claiming blue vigilante, or juggernaut claiming salmon vigilante.

13.comment: You can LISTEN to other's conversations. Replies not advised.
13.description: A blackmailer responds to a whisper that was not sent to them. For example, a guardian angel asks for their targets role and the blackmailer replies.

1.comment: I get that it's in your invest results, but be original man.
1.description: When voted up, the mafioso claims vigilante. They do this because the investigator results for mafioso contain vigilante.

2.description: The jester makes a super obvious play, like claiming an evil role. Town will sometimes pity guilty the jest.

3.comment: That's one dead mayor, or they're making a power play. Probably the former.
3.description: The mayor reveals. This could be good or bad. Sometimes the mayor is the dumbest member of the town.

4.comment: That dead person? My target obviously went there last night...obviously.
4.description: The executioner makes a super obvious play, such as tracking their target to a dead person.

5.comment: Gee, I wonder why this guy is immune?
5.description: The Godfather claims executioner as their role when voted up. This is because the executioner is immune and so is the Godfather.

6.description: The arsonist claims executioner as their role when voted up. Much like the Godfather, this is because executioner is immune.

7.comment: You, my good sir, are the exact opposite of a doctor.
7.description: The arsonist claims doctor, since it's the only town role in their investigator results.

8.comment: Let's be real, the mafia is getting lynched.
8.description: When the game gets down to the last few players, there will usually be a role call to determine everyone's actual roles and decide who's going to win.

9.comment: So much for my stealth vamp takeover.
9.description: A town member calls for, or starts, a vote for role. Usually, a confirmed town member, such as a veteran.

10.comment: Just because I saw you visit the medium, SK, doesn't make me an exe.
10.description: Someone, usually with incriminating results, gets called an executioner by the evil they are trying to get voted up.

11.description: Someone asks for a town protective or a lookout on them. This is a common Medusa bait.

12.comment: This is why survs get insta-lynched
12.description: Someone in a role that has defense claims survivor. This is because survivors also have defense on nights that they put on a bulletproof vest.

4.comment: Let's be honest, it was a hex bomb. The hex master won.

5.comment: Some people just wanna watch the world burn.

6.comment: Wait, you mean that doctor claim actually worked?

7.comment: How the heck did that happen?

9.comment: It's not a loss, so it counts as a win here!

10.comment: Not gonna lie, I'm actually kind of impressed.

11.comment: You're lying, you didn't see that end screen. Play fair.

confirmation.message: Are you sure? This action cannot be undone.
confirmation.title: Confirmation

bingo-task.free-space: This task is your free space. This was the original task for this space.
bingo-task.title: Task Information
